subject: Web3
title: Crypto Reporting Requirements
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Crypto Reporting Requirements.

hook.text: Starting in 2025, US crypto exchanges must report all user transactions to the IRS, just like stock brokerages.

buildup.text: The Infrastructure Investment Act of 2021 expanded the definition of 'broker' to include crypto platforms and possibly more.

discovery.text: Exchanges will issue 1099 forms to users and the IRS. Every trade, every gain, and every loss will be documented.

twist.text: DeFi platforms and self-custody wallets remain outside the reporting framework. The rules only cover centralized services.

climax.text: Crypto tax compliance is getting automated. The days of trading anonymously on US exchanges are ending.

punchline.text: Your exchange will send the IRS every trade you made. Surprise tax bills are coming.

quiz.question: What changes with US crypto reporting rules starting in 2025?
options: Exchanges must report all user transactions to the IRS like stock brokers
